meanings.definition: The quality or state of being fuzzy.
meanings.sent1: The fuzziness of the blanket made it extra cozy.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't see clearly through the fuzziness of the fog.
meanings.sent3: The fuzziness of the kitten's fur made it look like a little cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her memory had a gentle fuzziness, like a dream you can't quite grasp.
meanings.sent5: The fuzziness of the peach skin felt like a soft kiss on my fingertips.

meanings.definition: Lack of clarity or sharpness in an image or sound.
meanings.sent1: The old TV had a noticeable fuzziness to its picture.
meanings.sent2: The fuzziness of the radio signal made it hard to hear the music clearly.
meanings.sent3: The fuzziness of the photograph gave it a vintage charm.
meanings.sent4: His mind was clouded with a strange fuzziness, like static in the air.
meanings.sent5: The fuzziness of the distant mountain peaks made them seem like soft pillows.

meanings.definition: A feeling of confusion or uncertainty.
meanings.sent1: The fuzziness in her mind cleared up after a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent2: The fuzziness of the directions left us lost in the city.
meanings.sent3: The fuzziness of the situation made everyone giggle at the mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His decision was clouded by a strange fuzziness, like a fog in his thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The fuzziness of the test questions made her heart race with uncertainty.
